c1.title: Case Study: Calm Ops

b1.title: Currently building
b1.summary: An AI-native profile layer that turns a portfolio into a living feed of proof, progress, and context.

x1.comment: Rare combo of taste + engineering. The work shipped fast, stayed stable, and felt premium from day one.

x2.comment: Clear thinking, calm delivery, and excellent automation instincts. Everything came with a plan and a test story.

n1.title: on building calm tools
n1.body: most tools try to do too much. the best ones stay out of your way. i keep coming back to that when i design anything — what can i remove?

n2.title: dx matters more than you think
n2.body: if the developer experience is bad, the product will be bad. clean APIs, honest error messages, fast feedback loops — that's the foundation.

exp1.title: prompt chaining playground
exp1.what: a small sandbox for testing multi-step AI prompt chains visually.
exp1.why: i wanted to see how prompts compose before wiring them into production.
exp1.learned: sequential chains are fragile. branching and fallback paths matter more than the happy path.

exp2.title: cli task runner
exp2.what: a tiny CLI that reads a YAML task file and runs steps with retries and logging.
exp2.why: i kept writing the same bash scripts. this replaces them with something testable.
exp2.learned: YAML is fine for config but terrible for logic. keep task definitions declarative.
